[~hagleitn] your patches are full of tabs, this is the latest example. Your emacs-fu is weak :P

[~sseth] LLAP tests fail like so; is this related to using the wrong dag name to track queries, the patch that depends on 0.8.2 that you have posted?
{noformat}
, TaskAttempt 1 failed, info=[org.apache.hadoop.ipc.RemoteException(java.lang.RuntimeException): Dag -- INPUT_RECORDS: 2000 (2 row groups)
...100(Stage-1) already complete. Rejecting fragment [Map 1, 0, 1

Yes. HIVE-12448 will be required to get llap tests to work after this patch. This patch also depends on a newer version of Tez.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12784461 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
The lone new failure is due to a network issue.
+1 (in addition to a much earlier +1 by [~vikram.dixit])

Doc note:  *hive.query.name* should be documented in Configuration Properties, and whenever a Tez user doc is created it should be discussed there too.  Since the current Tez design doc doesn't go into any detail about configuration, *hive.query.name* doesn't need to be documented there.

If *hive.query.name* is a Tez-only parameter, it belongs in the Tez section of Configuration Properties; otherwise it belongs in the general query section and in the list at the beginning of the Tez section. 

* [Configuration Properties -- Tez | https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/Configuration+Properties#ConfigurationProperties-Tez]
* [Design Docs -- Hive on Tez -- Installation and Configuration | https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/Hive+on+Tez#HiveonTez-InstallationandConfiguration]

Added a TODOC2.0 label.
Doc update:  HIVE-16601 adds "Used by Spark to set the query name, will show up in the Spark UI" to the description (and function) of *hive.query.name* in release 3.0.0.
